other_tests.findings: Fine-needle aspiration biopsy of the major lesion showed splenic parenchyma, whereas a smaller one displayed the immunophenotype of a well-differentiated insulinoma.
The lesion was identified as an 8.0-mm benign insulinoma relapse on background nesidioblastosis, confirmed by intra-operative histopathological examination.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No further hypoglycemic episodes occurred after subtotal pancreatectomy, and altered glucose regulation within the prediabetes range was detected at the 6- and 9-month follow-up visits.

other_tests.findings: Severe hypoglycemia occurred only during Period C of treatment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The sensor glucose levels and associated events were monitored over multiple periods, indicating progression in glucose regulation and therapy response.
